meta.b: The dedicated, educational community of Newbury creates an engaging, encouraging, and compassionate environment for all students, providing opportunities while meeting each where they are and driving them forward.

div.a: School Tours are Cancelled until Further Notice

span.p: All school tours that were scheduled in April and May are cancelled until further notice. Please check back to the website for any updated school news.

span.p: The Newbury Memorabilia Committee has made some initial decisions about the school district's memorabilia. The State awards are going to be displayed at West Geauga High School, and the individual awards will be given to the individualwho earned that plaque, picture, or trophy. The team awards and class composite pictures are being put in storage until the Memorabilia Committee makes a final decision about their future placements. All awards are being memorialized digitally and will be made availableon-line to anyone who would like to download them. In addition, the digital copies of all of the awards will be displayed at West GeaugaHigh School in the interactive Hall of Fame Kiosk.

The Newbury Memorabilia Committee is taking requests for Newbury Schools memorabilia that is not an award or trophy, such as student artwork, uniforms, or banners. If you are a Newbury alumnus or Newbury community member and are interested in such memorabilia, please complete the following form
https://forms.gle/JRo4vznrShayKFJN7and submit it by May 8, 2020.
The Newbury Memorabilia Committee will hold a lottery for the requests at a public meeting on May 20, 2020. The pick-up dates for memorabilia items will be June 6, 2020.

div.p: Newbury Schools aims to be vigilant and proactive about the spread of diseases and germs.

ul.li: We disinfect and clean our buildings and buses thoroughly during this cold-flu season anyway.
PA Announcements on a daily basis for the next few weeks.
Nurse Cavanaugh will visit classrooms to demonstrate proper handwashing technique.
Encourage our students to use hand sanitizer stations during the day.
Encouraging our sick students and staff to stay home.
Continuing to track attendance to remain aware of trends.
Our administrators are attending regional informational meetings on the coronavirus so we stay up to date on safety measures.
